> Powered by [Codecov](https://codecov.io/gh/pandas-dev/pandas/pull/17143?src=pr&el=footer). Last update [8e6b09f...b41b713](https://codecov.io/gh/pandas-dev/pandas/pull/17143?src=pr&el=lastupdated). Read the [comment docs](https://docs.codecov.io/docs/pull-request-comments).

There is actually also another possible, more invasive option, which is to actually move the actual formatting logic (ar at least which ArrayFormatter class to use for a specific block, not necessarily the full formatter) to the block level. 
So in practice the minimal could be to move the if/else logic in `format_array` to the block level (https://github.com/pandas-dev/pandas/blob/f4330611ff5ac1cbb4a89c4a7dab3d0900f9e64a/pandas/io/formats/format.py#L1729-L1749). But not sure if that would be better (it would seem a bit cleaner as it doesn't involve such tedious if/else based on the type in format.py, but not sure how it would interact with index formatting)

> But not sure if that would be better (it would seem a bit cleaner as it doesn't involve such tedious if/else based on the type in format.py, but not sure how it would interact with index formatting)

yes this is exactly the reason. Since we don't have a full fledged 1d array type, with instead it being implemented mostly in Index/Series and then *again* in some of the Block logic, this avoids duplicated logic (the Index/Series also call this for formatting).
lgtm. (minor comment). merge away. not sure if you had other changes, but can of course always follow up.

Hello @jorisvandenbossche! Thanks for updating the PR.











Cheers ! There are no PEP8 issues in this Pull Request. :beers: 

##### Comment last updated on August 03, 2017 at 21:53 Hours UTC
